brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective study designed to identify factors that would predict patient adherence to CPAP
      (Continuous Positive Airway Pressure) therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adherence to Continuous Positive Airway Pressure Among Obstructive Sleep Apnoea Patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective study designed to identify factors that would predict patient adherence to CPAP
      therapy.

      Comparison between data recorded among patients and the data of the CPAP microchip.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adults (> 18 patients)

          -  All patients under CPAP (Continuous Positive Airway Pressure) therapy coming for
             annual visit in the Sart-Tilman Sleep Study Center

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient refusal

intervention.description: Comparison between the two groups (adherent and non-adherent patients) in order to discover criteria of non-adherence

clinical_study.official_title: Adherence to Continuous Positive Airway Pressure Among Obstructive Sleep Apnoea Patients. An Anaesthetic Algorithmic Approach to Prevent Postoperative Complications.

primary_outcome.description: Analyse of the data recorded by the CPAP microchip in order to assess the adherent or non-adherent status to the patient (adherent: CPAP use > 4 hours per night, non-adherent: less than 4 hours)
primary_outcome.measure: Number of hours of CPAP use by night

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of 72 criteria by a Lickert's scale in order to assess characteristics associated with non-adherence to CPAP therapy
secondary_outcome.measure: Lickert's scale to assess criteria of non-adherence

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
